thread.title: The perfect Gold Country picnic fare
thread.title_full: The perfect Gold Country picnic fare

author:
Mary Orlin

morlin@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: The perfect Gold Country picnic fare
text:
The perfect Gold Country picnic fare By Mary Orlin morlin@bayareanewsgroup.com Posted: 09/08/2015 03:00:00 PM PDT The deli case at Amador Vintage Market holds an assortment of fresh salads and such for picnic meals. (Jon Orlin) Related Stories Wine Country Picnic Recipe: 'La Veg' Sandwich The Gold Country's culinary scene brims with chic cafes, farm-to-fork bistros and gourmet to-go markets sit side by side. So before you tour wineries all day, make a stop at one of these spots that offer gourmet goodies to-go. Allez: Pick up tasty box lunches with French-inspired baguette sandwiches, salads and fruit tarts at this French bakery and cafe. 4242 Fowler Lane, Diamond Creek; www.allezeldorado.com . 
Amador Vintage Market: Before heading to the Shenandoah Valley, make a stop in Plymouth to pick up deli sandwiches, truffled chips, creative salads and the market's famous hummus, spiked with paprika and parsley. 9393 Main St., Plymouth; www.amadorvintagemarket.com . 
Dedrick's Cheese: You'll find gourmet cheeses and specialty items, including salumi, spreads and other noshes at this small shop on Placerville's main drag. 312 Main St., Placerville; www.facebook.com/dedrickscheese . 
The Farm Table: This farm-fresh bistro does a brisk business in to-go lunch fare, including house-made charcuterie and artisanal sandwiches. 311 Main St., Placerville; www.ourfarmtable.com . 
Sutter Creek Provisions: This modern-day general store stocks cheeses, olives, crackers, salumi and more. 78 Main St., Sutter Creek; www.facebook.com/suttercreekprovisions . Advertisement 
Sutter Creek Cheese Shoppe: Pack up picnic ingredients, including artisanal cheeses from around the world at this shop, where you get to sample before you buy. 33 Main St., Sutter Creek; www.suttercreekcheese.com . -- Mary Orlin, Staff
